'''Sydney Sweeney''' (born September 12, 1997)<ref>{{Cite web |title=On This Day in History - September 12th - Almanac - UPI.com |url=https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |access-date=2024-03-16 |website=UPI |archive-date=December 5, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191205204919/https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |url-status=live }}</ref> is an American actress. She first gained attention in 2018 for appearing in the television series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'' and ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'', and in the limited series ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]''. In the following year, she was featured in the [[Quentin Tarantino]]-directed film ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]''.

Sweeney gained wider recognition for her roles in the [[HBO]] drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]]'' (2019–present) and the first season of the anthology series ''[[The White Lotus]]'' (2021), which earned her nominations for two [[Primetime Emmy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Drama Series – 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=July 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220712154223/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Limited Or Anthology Series Or Movie – 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=September 22, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220922031924/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |url-status=live }}</ref> In 2023, she portrayed [[Reality Winner]] in the drama film ''[[Reality (2023 film)|Reality]]'' and led the commercially successful romantic comedy ''[[Anyone but You]]''. In 2024, she starred in the superhero film ''[[Madame Web (film)|Madame Web]]'', and produced and starred in the horror film ''[[Immaculate (2024 film)|Immaculate]]''.

==Early life==
Sydney Sweeney was born on September 12, 1997,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hebert|first1=Olivia|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/sydney-sweeney-birthday-party-theme-prom-b2413730.html|title=Sydney Sweeney shares photos from '80s prom-themed birthday bash|work=[[The Independent]]|date=September 18, 2023|access-date=March 2, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230924213825/https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/sydney-sweeney-birthday-party-theme-prom-b2413730.html|archive-date=September 24, 2023|url-status=live}}</ref> in [[Spokane, Washington]], to Lisa ({{Nee}} Mudd) and Steven Sweeney. Her mother is a former criminal defense lawyer, and her father is a hospitality professional.<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|url=https://variety.com/2023/tv/features/sydney-sweeney-not-typecast-cassie-reality-white-lotus-interview-1235688915/|title=Sydney Sweeney Takes Control: The 'Euphoria' Star on 'Feeling Beat Up' by Online Rumors and Proving People Wrong in Her Producer Era|last=D'Addario|first=Daniel|date=August 9, 2023|access-date=August 9, 2023|archive-date=August 9, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230809163555/https://variety.com/2023/tv/features/sydney-sweeney-not-typecast-cassie-reality-white-lotus-interview-1235688915/|url-status=live}}</ref> She has one brother.<ref name="chicago" /> Sweeney was raised in north [[Idaho]]<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|url=https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|title=Sydney Sweeney On Defying Expectations, Ambition And Launching Her Own Production Company|last=Burgum|first=Becky|date=February 8, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220209082649/https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|archive-date=February 9, 2022}}</ref> in the state's [[Idaho Panhandle|Panhandle region]] along the Washington border, at a rural lakeside home that her family has inhabited for five generations.<ref name=courier>{{cite news|url=https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|work=[[Bristol Herald Courier]]|title=Sydney Sweeney's road to stardom 'was not happy'|date=January 24, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220221041827/https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|archive-date=February 21, 2022}}</ref> Sweeney said she has a "religious family".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tinnin |first=Drew |date=August 14, 2018 |title=Interview: Sydney Sweeney on ALONG CAME THE DEVIL and UNDER THE SILVER LAKE |url=https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |access-date=July 29, 2022 |website=[[Dread Central]] |archive-date=July 29, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729033554/https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney attended middle school at [[Saint George's School (Spokane, Washington)|Saint George's School]] in Spokane.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020">{{cite news|url=https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|title=Actress Sydney Sweeney returns home to Spokane for fan visit at middle school|first=Emma|last= Epperly|newspaper=[[The Spokesman-Review]]|location=Spokane, Washington|date=February 3, 2020|access-date=September 9, 2020|archive-date=June 27, 2020|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20200627123326/https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|url-status=live}}</ref> She was active in numerous sports: "I was in every single sport possible", she said. "I was on the soccer team, the baseball team, the snow slalom ski team, I was wakeboarding." Sweeney said she had a wakeboarding accident as a child where the edge of her board propelled backward and sliced the area next to her eye, leaving a permanent scar.<ref name=courier/>

Sweeney became interested in acting after auditioning to be an extra in an independent film that was shooting in the Spokane area.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020" /> To convince her parents to allow her to pursue acting, she presented them with a five-year [[business plan]].<ref name="coveteur" /> Sweeney began to audition and book commercial acting jobs in Seattle and [[Portland, Oregon]], where the family temporarily resided, until choosing to relocate to Los Angeles when she was 13 years old.<ref>{{cite interview|last=Sweeney|first=Sydney|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|via=[[YouTube]]|series=AOL Build Series|title=Sydney Sweeney Talks About The HBO Series, "Euphoria"|date=June 24, 2019|time=2:30|access-date=January 21, 2022|archive-date=January 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220121170955/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|url-status=bot: unknown}}</ref>

In middle school, Sweeney was on the robotics team and participated in the mathematics club.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Sydney Sweeney Endures a Nightmare While Eating Spicy Wings Hot Ones |url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=a9ZhleGV4Qc&pp=ygUOc3lkbmV5IHN3ZWVuZXk%3D |access-date=January 28, 2024 |via=[[YouTube]] | date=January 25, 2024 |archive-date=February 26, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240226140011/https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=a9ZhleGV4Qc&pp=ygUOc3lkbmV5IHN3ZWVuZXk%3D |url-status=live }}</ref> She was [[valedictorian]] of her graduating class at [[Brighton Hall School]] in [[Burbank, California]].<ref name="Interview with Hollywood reporter">{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|title=Sydney Sweeney on Fame, Hollywood Fakery and the Pressure of Paying the Bills|last=Rankin|first=Seija|date=July 27, 2022|website=Hollywood Reporter|access-date=July 27, 2022|archive-date=July 27, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220727142756/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2016, Sweeney briefly worked at [[Universal Studios Hollywood]], but left after she had been hired for an acting job. She also briefly attended the [[University of California, Los Angeles]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Gardner |first=Chris |date=February 7, 2024 |title=Mystery Solved: Sydney Sweeney Was Telling the Truth About Being Employed at Universal Studios |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lifestyle/lifestyle-news/sydney-sweeney-universal-studios-backlot-tour-guide-tiktok-1235817959/ |access-date=February 7, 2024 |website=The Hollywood Reporter |archive-date=February 15, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240215040539/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lifestyle/lifestyle-news/sydney-sweeney-universal-studios-backlot-tour-guide-tiktok-1235817959/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Career==

===Early work (2016–2019)===
[[File:Sydney Sweeney 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg|thumb|upright|Sweeney in 2019]]
Sweeney began her career as a guest star in TV shows such as ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'', ''[[Criminal Minds]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' and ''[[Pretty Little Liars]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-Rue-on-euphoria--sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |title=You'll Recognize This 'Euphoria' Star From Some Of Your Favorite Shows |last=Grubbs |first=Jefferson |date=June 16, 2019 |magazine=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |access-date=July 3, 2019 |archive-date=June 17, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190617124555/https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-cassie-on-euphoria-sydney-sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="variety" /> Sweeney starred as Emaline Addario on the 2018 [[Netflix]] series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'', which revolved around two groups of [[High school (North America)|high school]] students in Oregon in 1996. She then appeared in the [[HBO]] miniseries ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'', recurring as Alice, a roommate whom [[Amy Adams]]' character meets at a [[psychiatric hospital|psychiatric facility]].<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="deadline" /> Her character was originally supposed to have a smaller role, but the director kept bringing her in for more scenes.<ref name="harpers" /> For the role, Sweeney studied stories of girls who experience [[mental disorder|mental illness]] and [[self-harm]]ing, and visited hospitals which had patients who self-harmed.<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="harpers" /> She filmed ''Everything Sucks!'' and ''Sharp Objects'' concurrently, the former during the week and latter on weekends.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |title='Sharp Objects' Star Sydney Sweeney Thanks Fans Who Say They "Hate" Her |last=Song |first=Sandar |date=July 9, 2018 |magazine=[[Nylon (magazine)|Nylon]] |access-date=June 25, 2019 |archive-date=June 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190623232446/https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney had a role in the film ''[[Under the Silver Lake]]'' in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gillespie|first1=Katherine|url=https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|title="Euphoria" Breakout Sydney Sweeney Shot by Cole Sprouse|work=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]]|date=April 9, 2020|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=October 15, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201015004956/https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|url-status=live}}</ref> She had a recurring role during the second season of the dystopian drama series ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'' as Eden Spencer, a pious and obedient girl from the totalitarian and theocratic Republic of Gilead.<ref name="variety" /> She also starred as the heroine in the horror film ''[[Along Came the Devil]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Murray|first1=Noel|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|title=Review: Mismatched pieces of exorcism thriller 'Along Came the Devil' don't fit|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 9, 2018|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=January 16, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210116161036/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|url-status=live}}</ref> The next year, Sweeney appeared in the drama film ''[[Clementine (2019 film)|Clementine]]'', the coming-of-age film ''[[Big Time Adolescence]]'', and [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://deadline.com/2017/10/startups-otmara-marrero-sydney-sweeney-clementine-movie-1202182597/ |title='StartUp's Otmara Marrero, Sydney Sweeney & More Cast In |url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-sydney-sweeney-machine-gun-kelly-big-time-adolescence-american-high-1202417478/ |title=Pete Davidson, Sydney Sweeney, Machine Gun Kelly & More Join 'Big Time Adolescence' From American High |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |date=June 26, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |access-date=June 26, 2018 |archive-date=June 27, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180828035848/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/danny-strong-sydney-sweeney-join-once-a-time-hollywood-1129521 |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Breakthrough (2019–present) ===
In June 2019, Sweeney began portraying [[List of Euphoria characters#Cassandra "Cassie" Howard|Cassie Howard]], a teenager with a promiscuous reputation, in the [[HBO]] drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]].''<ref>{{cite web|last1=Chuba|first1=Kirsten|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|title='Euphoria' Star Sydney Sweeney on Tackling Teen Pregnancy, Abortion Discussions|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 29, 2019|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=July 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190730013116/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|url-status=live}}</ref> The show was a breakout hit, becoming the second most watched [[HBO]] series.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/euphoria-season-2-finale-ratings-1235192015/ |title='Euphoria' Is Now HBO's Second-Most Watched Show Behind 'Game of Thrones' |last=Mass |first=Jennifer |date=February 28, 2022 |access-date=March 14, 2024 |archive-date=March 14, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240314224444/https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/euphoria-season-2-finale-ratings-1235192015/amp/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Her performance received praise, earning a nomination for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]].<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Moreau |first1=Jordan |last2=Schneider |first2=Michael |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Emmys 2022: The Complete Nominations List |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/awards/emmys-nominations-list-2022-1235313788/ |access-date=August 17, 2022 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |archive-date=July 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220712160603/https://variety.com/2022/tv/awards/emmys-nominations-list-2022-1235313788/ |url-status=live }}</ref> ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' asserted that the role of Cassie "proves that Sweeney's one hell of a shapeshifter between her deft turns in this, ''The Handmaid's Tale'', ''Everything Sucks'' and ''Sharp Objects''."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Framke |first=Caroline |date=June 13, 2019 |title=TV Review: HBO's 'Euphoria' Starring Zendaya |url=https://variety.com/2019/tv/reviews/euphoria-hbo-review-zendaya-1203235780/ |access-date=June 12, 2023 |website=Variety |archive-date=April 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200412070742/https://variety.com/2019/tv/reviews/euphoria-hbo-review-zendaya-1203235780/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Her many nude scenes in the series received significant attention, generating discussions about [[nudity in film]] and the [[male gaze]]. Despite this, Sweeney has stated she would not stop doing nude scenes.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |title=Sydney Sweeney 'won't stop' doing nude scenes |access-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327171623/https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |url-status=live |work=CNN |first=Lisa |last=Respers France |date=July 28, 2022}}</ref>

Sweeney is the founder of production company Fifty-Fifty Films, launched in 2020.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nellie Andreeva |date=July 31, 2020 |title=Sydney Sweeney To Star In & EP 'Players Table' Series For Jean-Marc Vallée & Nathan Ross As She Launches Production Company |url=https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/ |access-date=February 8, 2023 |website=Deadline |archive-date=August 1, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200801230955/https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/ |url-status=live }}</ref> The same year, she starred in the TV film ''[[Nocturne (2020 film)|Nocturne]]'' as well as [[Webtoon]]’s live-action advertisement for the online comic ''[[Lore Olympus]]'', appearing as Persephone.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Sydney Sweeney Battles Her Dark Side In Webtoon's Latest Short Film |url=https://adage.com/creativity/work/webtoon-lore-olympus/2287156 |access-date=2024-05-11 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=LORE OLYMPUS Starring Sydney Sweeney (Full Version) WEBTOON |url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=yb3T-hIeKpM |access-date=2024-05-11 |via=[[YouTube]] | date=October 15, 2020 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://deadline.com/2019/09/sydney-sweeney-madison-iseman-nocturne-cast-blumhouse-amazon-studios-movie-1202748475/|title='Nocturne': 'Euphoria's Sydney Sweeney & 'Annabelle 3's Madison Iseman To Star In First Title In Blumhouse TV-Amazon Deal|last=D'Alessandro|first=Anthony|date=September 30, 2019|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|access-date=September 30, 2019|archive-date=December In 2021, Sweeney appeared in the first season of [[Mike White (filmmaker)|Mike White]]'s anthology black comedy series ''[[The White Lotus]]''<ref>{{cite web|last1=White|first1=Peter|url=https://deadline.com/2020/10/hbo-the-white-lotus-enlighteneds-mike-white-connie-britton-alexandra-daddario-natasha-rothwell-sydney-sweeney-1234599772/|title='Enlightened's sophomore.<ref name="CharactersNames">{{cite press release|title=New HBO Limited Series THE WHITE LOTUS From Mike White Debuts July 11|url=https://pressroom.warnermedia.com/us/media-release/new-hbo-limited-series-white-lotus-mike-white-debuts-july-11|work=[[WarnerMedia]]|date=May 10, 2021|access-date=May 10, 2021|archive-date=May For her portrayal of the character, she was nominated for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]]. Her accomplishments earned her a place on the [[Time 100#Time 100 Next list|''Time'' 100 Next list]] for 2022.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Apatow|first1=Maude|url=https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|title=Sydney Sweeney|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=September 28, 2022|access-date=October 2, 2022|archive-date=September 30, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220930083008/https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|url-status=live}}</ref>

[[File:Sydney Sweeney at Berlinale 2023 (portrait).jpg|alt=Sweeney smiling|thumb|upright|Sweeney in 2023]]
In January 2023, Sweeney became a brand ambassador for companies [[Armani|Armani Beauty]] and [[Laneige]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 16, 2023 |title=Sydney Sweeney Is the New Face of Armani Fragrances |url=https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/sydney-sweeney-is-the-new-face-of-armani-fragrances |access-date=February 10, 2023 |website=The Fashion Enthusiast |archive-date=January 6, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240106144038/https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/sydney-sweeney-is-the-new-face-of-armani-fragrances |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=January 5, 2024 |title=Laneige Picks Sydney Sweeney as Their First-Ever Global Ambassador |url=https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/laneige-picks-sydney-sweeney-as-their-first-ever-global-ambassador |access-date=January 6, 2024 |website=The Fashion Enthusiast |archive-date=January 6, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240106144045/https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/laneige-picks-sydney-sweeney-as-their-first-ever-global-ambassador |url-status=live }}</ref> She starred as [[U.S. Air Force]] veteran [[Reality Winner]] in [[Tina Satter]]'s thriller drama ''[[Reality (2023 film)|Reality]]'', which premiered at the [[73rd Berlin Film Festival]]. Steph Green of [[IndieWire]] found the film "inventively mounted and extraordinarily tense" and labelled Sweeney as "the real deal."<ref>{{Cite web |date=February 18, 2023 |title='Reality' Review: Sydney Sweeney Stuns in Fact-Based Single-Room Whistleblower Thriller |url=https://www.indiewire.com/2023/02/reality-review-sydney-sweeney-1234811450/ |access-date=February 20, 2023 |website=IndieWire Years later, she purchased the rights to the screenplay and hired frequent collaborator Michael Mohan to direct.<ref>{{Cite web |first=Bryan |last=Davids |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-features/immaculate-director-sydney-sweeney-1235854844/ |title='Immaculate' Director Michael Mohan Had a Front Row Seat to the Rise of Sydney Sweeney |website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=March 18, 2024 |access-date=March 18, 2024 |archive-date=March 27, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240327142900/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-features/immaculate-director-sydney-sweeney-1235854844/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Sweeney has said that she considered producing a way to create opportunities for herself.<ref>{{cite web|first=Daniel|last=D'Addario|url=https://variety.com/2024/film/news/sydney-sweeney-immaculate-glen-powell-euphoria-season-3-1235943028/|title=Sydney Sweeney on 'Immaculate,' a Rom-Com Reunion With Glen Powell and the 'Weird' Way People Talk About Her Body: 'They Believe I've Signed My Life Away'|website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=March 18, 2024|accessdate=April 5, 2024}}</ref> Later that year, she co-starred in ''[[Eden (2024 film)|Eden]]'' directed by [[Ron Howard]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Andreas|last=Wiseman|title=Vanessa Kirby & Sydney Sweeney Join Jude Law, Ana De Armas & Daniel Brühl In Ron Howard's Renamed Survival Thriller 'Eden' Ahead Of November Shoot; Hans Zimmer To Score For Imagine & AGC — AFM |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 30, 2023 |url=https://deadline.com/2023/10/sydney-sweeney-vanessa-kirby-hans-zimmer-join-jude-law-ana-de-armas-ron-howard-eden-movie-australia-1235587009/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231030152628/https://deadline.com/2023/10/sydney-sweeney-vanessa-kirby-hans-zimmer-join-jude-law-ana-de-armas-ron-howard-eden-movie-australia-1235587009/ |archive-date=October 30, 2023 |access-date=October 31, 2023 }}</ref> Reviewing the film for ''[[TheWrap]],'' critic Chase Hutchinson said: " (Sweeney) runs away with the whole thing ... it's her subtle looks and a growing agency that turns ''Eden'' into something more ... every moment with her at the forefront is ''Eden'' at its best."<ref>[https://www.thewrap.com/eden-review-sydney-sweeney-movie/ ‘Eden’ Review: Sydney Sweeney Steals the Show in Ron Howard’s Darkly Silly Historical Thriller]</ref>

Sweeney will next star alongside [[Julianne Moore]] in  ''[[Echo Valley (film)|Echo Valley]]''.<ref name="echo">{{Cite web |last=Donnelly |first=Matt |date=March 8, 2023 |title=Julianne Moore, Sydney Sweeney Team for New Apple Feature From ''Mare of Easttown'' Creator Brad Ingelsby |url=https://variety.com/2023/film/news/julianne-moore-sydney-sweeney-apple-movie-mare-easttown-ingelsby-1235546936 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230308174353/https://variety.com/2023/film/news/julianne-moore-sydney-sweeney-apple-movie-mare-easttown-ingelsby-1235546936/ |archive-date=March 8, 2023 |access-date=March 8, 2023 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]}}</ref> She will also produce and star in an as-yet untitled biopic of boxer [[Christy Martin (boxer)|Christy Martin]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Wiseman |first1=Andreas |title=Sydney Sweeney Getting Into The Ring To Portray Trailblazing Boxer Christy Martin For Director David Michôd, Black Bear & Anonymous Content; Actress Is "Itching To Start Training" For Role – Cannes Market Hot Project |url=https://deadline.com/2024/05/sydney-sweeney-boxer-christy-martin-movie-biopic-david-michod-1235903974 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240508185245/https://deadline.com/2024/05/sydney-sweeney-boxer-christy-martin-movie-biopic-david-michod-1235903974/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=May 8, 2024 |website=Deadline Hollywood|access-date=June 9, 2024 |date=May 8, 2024}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Sweeney is engaged to businessman Jonathan Davino as of 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 1, 2023 |title=Who Is Sydney Sweeney's Fiancé? All About Jonathan Davino |url=https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/who-is-sydney-sweeneys-fiance-all-about-jonathan-davino |access-date=January 2, 2024 |website=The Fashion Enthusiast |archive-date=January 2, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240102082741/https://thefashionenthusiast.uk/stories/who-is-sydney-sweeneys-fiance-all-about-jonathan-davino |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=December 19, 2023 |title=Sydney Sweeney is the moment |url=https://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/article/sydney-sweeney-interview-december-2023 |access-date=December 20, 2023 |website=Glamour UK|archive-date=December 20, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231220212003/https://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/article/sydney-sweeney-interview-december-2023 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="people.com">{{Cite web |title=Who Is Sydney Sweeney's Fiancé? All About Jonathan Davino |url=https://people.com/who-is-jonathan-davino-sydney-sweeney-8419400 |access-date=2024-04-17 |website=Peoplemag |archive-date=April 15, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240415233239/https://people.com/who-is-jonathan-davino-sydney-sweeney-8419400 |url-status=live }}</ref> They produce films together (including ''Anyone but You''), and Sweeney considers Davino to be her "producing partner."<ref name="people.com"/>

Besides her native language English, Sweeney speaks Russian and Spanish. She taught herself Russian in high school, and learned Spanish at school for most of her life, as her father lives in [[Mexico]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-28 |title=Sydney Sweeney taught herself Russian in high school |url=https://uk.news.yahoo.com/sydney-sweeney-taught-herself-russian-213045322.html |access-date=2024-06-08 |website=Yahoo News}}</ref>

Sweeney is an automobile enthusiast, and has restored a 1969 [[Ford Bronco]] and a 1965 [[Ford Mustang]]. In partnership with Ford motor company, she designed a custom 2024 Mustang.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://torquecafe.com/sydney-sweeney-reveals-custom-ford-mustang/ |title=Meet the Hollywood star who loves cars |last=Ottley |first=Stephen |date=2024-01-31 |website=torquecafe.com |access-date=2024-10-29}}</ref>
